summary: Diff adds a Motoko backend actor with per-user resume/location storage, job postings, job matching, and application entities, plus a frontend UI for authentication, resume/cover letter/location editors, jobs list/detail, and an apply flow. Some required behaviors (job editing, sorting by match score, and recording 'Go to Application' link-open events) are not evidenced in the provided diff summary.

missing_requirements.requirement: User can add, edit, and delete job entries.
missing_requirements.reason: Adding and deleting are evidenced (JobFormDialog add + JobDetail delete), but no UI or API usage for editing an existing job entry is shown in the diff summary.

missing_requirements.requirement: User can sort jobs by match score (descending).
missing_requirements.reason: JobsFiltersBar exposes a sort selector and JobsList keeps a sortBy state, but the computed list shown (filteredAndSortedJobs) applies filtering only and shows no sorting implementation in the provided snippet.

missing_requirements.requirement: Record an event/timestamp that the user opened the application link for that job.
missing_requirements.reason: JobDetail opens the application URL in a new tab, and calls ensureApplication(), but no explicit backend call to record a 'link opened' event/timestamp is shown in the frontend, and the backend snippet does not show a dedicated function/event for recording link-open actions.

hallucinated_features.description: User profile setup/management (name and optional email) with a mandatory onboarding dialog.
hallucinated_features.reason: BuildRequest focuses on resume/cover letter/location, jobs, matching, and application workflow; a separate user profile (name/email) and profile setup dialog were not requested.

hallucinated_features.description: Admin-token based access control initialization via URL parameter (caffeineAdminToken) and explicit permission checks (admin/user).
hallucinated_features.reason: BuildRequest specifies Internet Identity only, but does not request admin-token bootstrapping or an admin role/permission system.
Requirement only asks to support marking as 'Applied' and storing history/status; additional statuses are extra and not explicitly requested.
